alert.note: Alert for Macomb; St. Clair (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 19 at 6:31AM EDT by NWS Detroit
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms in northeastern Macomb and St. Clair Counties through 715 AM EDT... At 628 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Capac to near Marysville to Algonac. Movement was northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds near 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... St. Clair, Marysville and Marine City around 635 AM EDT. Port Huron around 645 AM EDT. Lakeport around 705 AM EDT. Other locations impacted by these storms include Anchorville, North Street, Adair, Rattle Run, Goodells, Ray Center, Brockway, Smiths Creek, Fair Haven and Wadhams. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
